title: BBC Local Live: Beds, Herts & Bucks on Tuesday, 26 January 2016. - BBC News
summary: hertfordshire-based tesco has been found to have breached the industry code of practice by withholding payments to suppliers .
author sir terry pratchett could be honoured with a commemorative plaque in beaconsfield , where he grew up .
news , sport , travel and weather updates resume at 08:00 on wednesday .

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: thanks for joining us for a full day of news for beds , herts and bucks .
see you again at 08:00 tomorrow .

documents.title: weather : windy with patchy rain overnight
text: it will be cloudy and windy overnight with outbreaks of patchy rain or drizzle as temperatures drop to 10c ( 50f ) .
wednesday will have strong south westerly winds , but will be mainly dry at first .
temperatures will peak at 13c ( 55f ) .
visit bbc weather for full details .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: croxley car parking frustration
text: the rising number of commuters parking near a station has left people unable to park on their own driveways .
author: Watford Observer

documents.title: headlines : hospital closes minor injuries service pcc could take over fire service
text: the news headlines for the three counties this evening :
author: Jessica Cooper
BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: milton keynes crash victim serious but stable
text: a man is in a serious condition in hospital after suffering life-threatening injuries in a crash in milton keynes .
the 30-year-old was in a silver peugeot which collided with a silver audi on the h10 bletcham way at the junction with monellan grove late on friday , 22 january .
a 39-year-old man from milton keynes has been arrested on sus of careless driving and of drinking while above the legal alcohol limit .

documents.title: marsh farm to undergo £ 28m reburbishment
text: work has begun on transforming the marsh farm housing estate in luton .
the first phase of the £ 28m regeneration programme involves the building of seven new shops with 24 new apartments above them .
once this is complete , the purley centre , made up of 1960s shops and flats , will be demolished and replaced with 93 homes .
author: Gail Sanderson
BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: two link options for luton airport rail link
text: ambitious plans to link luton airport and parkway station by rail have been narrowed down to two final options , the luton news can reveal .
author: Luton News

documents.title: new incinerator plans for hertfordshire
text: the company behind a failed attempt to build a waste incinerator at new barnfield in hertfordshire has come up with an alternative plan for hoddesdon .
the proposed facility is designed to treat all residential waste collected by the council in hertfordshire and generate low carbon electricity .
hertfordshire county council asked veolia to submit an alternative plan after its original £ 1bn project ( was rejected by the government .
author: Jane Killick
BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: afternoon headlines : herts-based tesco delayed payments , investigation finds lister hospital suspends adult minor injuries service
text: the top stories :
author: Jessica Cooper
BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: fewer people needing help from milton keynes food bank
text: the number of people going to the food bank in milton keynes has dropped by a quarter over the past year .
project manager john marshall says fewer people needed its services in 2015 compared with 2014 .
author: Neil Bradford
BBC Look East

documents.title: pcc thumbs up for plans to give him control over fire service
text: the police and crime commission for hertfordshire has welcomed plans announced by the government to allow pcc 's to take over running local fire services in england .
david lloyd says he welcomes the fact all emergency services will have a duty to co-operate and the flexibility to develop local ways of working .
the fire brigades union says the plans are a dangerous and costly experiment .
author: Jessica Cooper
BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: weather : rain this afternoon
text: this afternoon will see increasingly cloudy conditions with outbreaks of rain pushing in from the west during the late afternoon .
although it will be mild , it will also become very windy , especially over higher ground such as the dunstable downs .
maximum temperature : 11c ( 52f ) .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: adults with minor injuries asked not to go to the lister hospital
text: the minor injuries service at the lister hospital in stevenage has been temporarily suspended due to record numbers of patients .

the east and north hertfordshire nhs trust says its had high numbers of very seriously ill patients and , in order to maintain their safety , adults with illnesses which do n't put their lives at risk should go to the new qeii hospital in welwyn .
the changes do n't apply to children , who 'll still be treated in the children 's emergency department although waiting times may be longer than normal .

documents.title: headlines : herts-based tesco delayed payments to suppliers increase in unexpected mental health deaths in hertfordshire
text: the top stories going into this afternoon :
author: Jessica Cooper
BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: the big picture : red sky in the morning
text: this stunning of the sky over bedford was taken this morning by alex pope .
if you have any images you 'd like us to use on this page please email bhblive @ bbc.co.uk

documents.title: parents disowned cocaine-dealing brothers
text: two st albans brothers have each been jailed for three years for dealing cocaine to feed their own drugs habits .

st albans crown court heard the parents of uzzal , 28 , and afzal miah , 25 , feared they would lose their home in dellfield following a police raid in october last year in which cocaine and thousand of pounds in cash were discovered .
the brothers pleaded guilty via a prison link from bedford jail to possessing class a drugs with intent to supply .
author: Gail Sanderson
BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: tesco knowingly delayed payments to suppliers
text: hertfordshire-based tesco seriously breached the industry 's code of conduct to protect grocery suppliers , the supermarket ombudsman has found .
the grocery code adjudicator , christine tacon , found extensive evidence the supermarket had acted unreasonably when delaying payments to suppliers .
an accounting scandal which uncovered a black hole of £ 250m led the supermarket chain to make savings , including moving its headquarters from cheshunt to welwyn garden city .

documents.title: chance to move in to historic bank building in newport pagnell
text: ​the former hsbc historical building in newport pagnell is up for let after the bank closed earlier this month .
author: One MK

documents.title: deaths of hertfordshire mental health patients rise
text: unexpected deaths among mental health patients under nhs care in hertfordshire have risen sharply , as part of a national trend highlighted by figures obtained by the liberal democrats under a freedom of information request .
in the three years to 2015 , the number of serious incidents in hertfordshire rose from 13 to 60 , and unexpected deaths rose from six to 31 .
the latest figures for the first five months of last year show seven suicides or suspected suicides in the hertfordshire partnership nhs foundation trust .
author: Carol Abercrombie
BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: luton-based easyjet 's profits dip following terror attacks
text: easyjet says the attacks in paris and cancelled flights to egypt led to a fall in revenue for the three months to december .
but the luton-based low-cost airline says a new year recovery has put it back on track to make their expected profits .
revenue per seat declined by 3.7 % in the final quarter of 2015 , but market forecasts are still for the airline to post a pre-tax profit of £ 738m .

documents.title: morning headlines : herts mental health deaths rise sir terry pratchett honour plans for beaconsfield
text: the top stories :
author: Simon Oxley
BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: the big picture : logs in hertfordshire
text: today 's big was taken in ashridge woodlands in hertfordshire .
thanks to amber gardner for the photograph .

documents.title: travel : a600 partially blocked in bedfordshrie
text: north drive in shortstown is partially blocked in both directions between the a600 the highway junction and the south drive junction because of a shed load and an accident involving a lorry .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: mk dons looking for a new striker
text: the milton keynes dons ' executive director andrew cullen says they are doing all they can to sign a striker in this month 's transfer window .
the dons have been given a financial boost with this weekend 's fa cup tie against chelsea , but he says it 's still not going to be easy
if they 're scoring goals , they 're not going to come to you on loan and if they 're scoring goals , you 're going to have to pay a significant fee for them . ''
author: Simon Oxley
BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: terry pratchett 's home town plans to honour author
text: author sir terry pratchett could be honoured with a commemorative plaque in beaconsfield , where he was born and grew up .
the plan is to unveil it at the library on reynolds road where pratchett worked on saturdays , and later returned to give talks .

documents.title: weather : dry this morning but some rain this afternoon
text: it will be a dry morning with some limited brightness , but cloud with some outbreaks of rain will spread from the west after midday .
it will be mild and become very windy , especially over and to the north of the chilterns .
maximum temperature : 11c ( 52f ) .
author: BBC Weather
